### Prerequisites

- [X] Write a descriptive title.
- [X] Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- [X] Search the existing issues.
- [X] Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- [X] Refer to [Differences between Windows PowerShell 5.1 and PowerShell](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/differences-from-windows-powershell).

### Steps to reproduce

I've discovered that an `ErrorRecord` produces a garbled `Exception.Message` when the text contains `\r\n` _(Windows style)_ line endings.

Steps performed:
  * Use `Get-Content` to obtain the content of a text file containing `env = DEV` on three separate lines with `\r\n` line endings.
  * Use `ConvertFrom-StringData` against the file content. An error will occur due to the repetition of the key.
  * Inspect the value of `$Error.Exception.Message`. The message should be `Data item 'env' in line 'env = DEV' is already defined.` but is shown as `' is already defined. e 'env = DEV`.

Repeating the steps above with a file containing `\n` line endings results in `$Error.Exception.Message` being displayed correctly.

### Expected behavior

```console
`$Error.Exception.Message` should show `Data item 'env' in line 'env = DEV' is already defined.` but instead shows `' is already defined. e 'env = DEV`.
```


### Actual behavior

```console
PS C:\> $string = Get-Content 'C:\bitbucket\settings-crlf.txt' -Raw
PS C:\> $string
env = DEV
env = DEV
env = DEV
PS C:\> $string.Replace("`r", '\r').Replace("`n", '\n')
env = DEV\r\nenv = DEV\r\nenv = DEV
PS C:\> ConvertFrom-StringData $string
ConvertFrom-StringData: Data item 'env' in line 'env = DEV' is already defined.
PS C:\> $Error.Exception

ErrorRecord    : Data item 'env' in line 'env = DEV' is already defined.
TargetSite     : Void ProcessRecord()
Message        : Data item 'env' in line 'env = DEV' is already defined.
Data           : {}
InnerException :
HelpLink       :
Source         : Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.Utility
HResult        : -2146233079
StackTrace     :    at Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.ConvertFromStringDataCommand.ProcessRecord()
                    at System.Management.Automation.Cmdlet.DoProcessRecord()
                    at System.Management.Automation.CommandProcessor.ProcessRecord()


PS C:\> $Error.Exception.Message
' is already defined. e 'env = DEV
PS C:\> $Error.Clear()
PS C:\> $string = Get-Content 'C:\bitbucket\settings-lf.txt' -Raw
PS C:\> $string
env = DEV
env = DEV
env = DEV
PS C:\> $string.Replace("`r", '\r').Replace("`n", '\n')
env = DEV\nenv = DEV\nenv = DEV
PS C:\> ConvertFrom-StringData $string
ConvertFrom-StringData: Data item 'env' in line 'env = DEV' is already defined.
PS C:\> $Error.Exception

ErrorRecord    : Data item 'env' in line 'env = DEV' is already defined.
TargetSite     : Void ProcessRecord()
Message        : Data item 'env' in line 'env = DEV' is already defined.
Data           : {}
InnerException :
HelpLink       :
Source         : Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.Utility
HResult        : -2146233079
StackTrace     :    at Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.ConvertFromStringDataCommand.ProcessRecord()
                    at System.Management.Automation.CommandProcessor.ProcessRecord()


PS C:\> $Error.Exception.Message
Data item 'env' in line 'env = DEV' is already defined.
```

comments.body:
It looks like the cmdlet creating the error is stripping LF but leaving CR ``` $error[0].exception.message -replace "`r","\r" -replace "`n","\n" Data item 'env' in line 'env = dev\r' is already defined. ``` In fact looking at https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/src/Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.Utility/commands/utility/ConvertFrom-StringData.cs Line 58 ``` string[] lines = _stringData.Split('\n'); foreach (string line in lines) { string s = line.Trim(); ``` Means each `line` will end with \r and `s` will have it removed Then the error is thrown which is used ... Line 70 ``` throw PSTraceSource.NewInvalidOperationException( ConvertFromStringData.InvalidDataLine, line); ``` Line 80 ``` throw PSTraceSource.NewInvalidOperationException( ConvertFromStringData.DataItemAlreadyDefined, line, name); ``` if those use `s` instead of line that should fix it.
